title: Peru to Free Ex-Leader Fujimori, Defying International Court
description: Peru will free jailed former-President Alberto Fujimori on Thursday, in the Andean country’s most dramatic challenge yet to an international court that counts all of Latin America’s major economies as members.

title: Biden Will Award $8.2 Billion to Boost Rail in Key 2024 States
description: President Joe Biden will announce $8.2 billion in additional railway funds this week, according to a person familiar with the matter, boosting potential projects — including a high-speed line to Las Vegas — in important states for the 2024 election.

title: Bank Executives, Lawmakers Skip the Fireworks at Senate Hearing
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Josh Wingrove looks at how top bank executives fared at a Senate hearing . Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Senators Demand More Oversight Over Israel’s Use of US Weapons
description: Five Democratic senators urged the Biden administration to impose more oversight over Israel’s use of US-provided weapons to ensure that they don’t cause more civilian casualties.

title: Biden Moves to Forgive Nearly $5 Billion in Student Loans
description: President Joe Biden moved to forgive $4.8 billion in student loans Wednesday, providing relief to more than 80,000 borrowers including public sector employees and Americans who have been repaying their federal debts for decades.

title: G-7 to Ban Russian Diamonds Starting Next Year
description: Group of Seven nations have agreed to ban Russian diamond imports from the start of next year in the latest move to curb Russia’s ability to fund its invasion of Ukraine.

title: Canada to Curb Oil, Gas Emissions With Cap-and-Trade Regime
description: Canada plans to limit emissions from the country’s oil and gas industry using a cap-and-trade system, a policy that will become a cornerstone of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s efforts to help curtail global warming and is almost certain to meet resistance in the western provinces.

title: UK Immigration Minister Jenrick Quits After Rwanda Deportation Bill Introduced
description: UK Immigration Minister Robert Jenrick quit his post on Wednesday after the government published legislation designed to implement its policy of deporting asylum seekers to Rwanda.

title: Russian Uranium Import Ban Teed Up for US House Floor Vote
description: Legislation that would bar the import of enriched Russian uranium into the US has been teed up for a vote in the US House of Representatives.

title: House GOP Threatens to Hold Hunter Biden in Contempt of Congress
description: House Republicans are threatening to hold the president’s son, Hunter Biden, in contempt of Congress if he doesn’t show up for closed-door questioning by congressional investigators.

title: UN Chief Steps Up Pressure for Gaza Cease-Fire With Rare Appeal
description: United Nations chief Antonio Guterres stepped up his calls for a cease-fire in the Gaza Strip, invoking a rarely used power to press the Security Council over a crisis he said is “fast deteriorating into a catastrophe.”

title: How West Bank, Settlements Fit Into Israel-Hamas War
description: In the months before militants of the Palestinian group Hamas launched a new war by bursting out of the Gaza Strip Oct. 7 to commit a massacre in Israel, a different enclave, the West Bank, had been the greater source of friction between Israelis and Palestinians. Now, the war between Israel and Hamas has further inflamed conflict there. In the West Bank, unlike in Gaza, not only are Israeli soldiers ever-present, so are Israeli civilians. They are residents of the so-called West Bank settlement

title: Biden Says He’s Not the Only Democrat Who Could Beat Trump
description: President Joe Biden said dozens of Democrats could beat Donald Trump but he still has the best chance of preventing the Republican former president from returning to the White House.

title: Maduro Targets Machado’s Top Aides in Venezuela Referendum Plot
description: Venezuela’s government ordered the arrest of three top aides to opposition leader María Corina Machado for their alleged involvement in a plot to sabotage a referendum on the disputed Essequibo region in Guyana.

title: Dimon Says He Would Shut Down Crypto If He Had Government Role
description: Jamie Dimon told US lawmakers he would shutter the cryptocurrency industry if he had their power.

title: Here Are the Key Takeaways From Bank CEO Hearing in Senate
description: Here are the key takeaways from the Senate Banking Committee’s Wall Street oversight hearing in Washington Wednesday, featuring eight big-bank CEOs:

title: Ukrainian Ex-Lawmaker Who Pushed Kremlin Agenda Killed in Russia
description: Ukrainian agents gunned down a former pro-Kremlin lawmaker who fled the country before it was invaded by Russian forces, according to an official familiar with the killing.

title: US Says Russians Tortured American in First War Crimes Case
description: US prosecutors on Wednesday accused four Russia-affiliated military personnel of detaining and torturing an American citizen in Ukraine, the first charges ever filed under a US war crimes statute passed nearly 30 years ago.

title: Sunak’s Rwanda Bill Seeks to Waive Some Human Rights Law
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak proposed waiving some elements of international human rights law in the UK as he sought to push his controversial plan to fly asylum seekers to Rwanda through Parliament.

title: TSMC, Labor Unions Reach Labor Accord for Phoenix Chip Site
description: Arizona labor unions and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. have reached an agreement to resolve persistent labor disputes that have dogged the chipmaker’s construction site in Phoenix, according to a joint statement.

title: The Bad News and the Less Bad News: The Readout with Philip Aldrick
description: What did we learn from Boris’s appearance at the Covid inquiry, besides the fact that he still cuts his own hair?

title: Zelenskiy Assures G-7 Fight Will Go On Even Amid Doubts on Aid
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy vowed to press on with the counteroffensive against Russia as he asked Group of Seven leaders to push back against mounting uncertainty over financial support from the US.

title: Fentanyl Traffickers’ Funding Targeted by Yellen in Mexico Trip
description: The US is stepping up efforts to keep drug money out of its financial system and stem the flood of fentanyl across its southern border, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said after a visit to a crime lab in Mexico City.

title: Republican McCarthy Says He Is Leaving Congress at End of Year
description: Republican Kevin McCarthy, whose brief and tumultuous turn leading the US House culminated in the first ouster of a speaker, said Wednesday he will resign from Congress at the end of the year.

title: Lithuania Drafts Law to Strip Citizenship After Abramovich Report
description: Lithuania said it’s drafting legislation that will allow more people to be stripped of citizenship after it was reported that Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich passed on some of his wealth to two of his children who had passports from the Baltic nation just weeks before he was sanctioned.

title: Contentious South Africa Health Insurance Law Passes Next Hurdle
description: Legislation aimed at reforming South Africa’s health system through a controversial national insurance plan was approved by a second parliamentary chamber, which ignored pleas from opposition parties, doctors and business groups to change it.

title: Trump Supporters Want His GOP Rivals to Drop Out, New Poll Shows
description: A majority of Republican presidential frontrunner Donald Trump’s supporters want an uncontested primary race even as his opponents struggle to unite around a single challenger, according to a new survey.

title: Biden to Push Congress on Ukraine Aid in Speech as Funds Stall
description: President Joe Biden will urge US lawmakers to approve additional aid for Ukraine in an address from the White House on Wednesday, as Republican objections have stalled fresh support for a third straight month.

title: Petro Notches Win in His Push to Reform Colombia’s Health System
description: Colombia’s Lower House approved the government’s health-care reform, which seeks to limit the role of the private sector, in a victory for President Gustavo Petro.

title: US Defense Secretary Austin Calls for Swift Passage of Funding Package for Ukraine
description: US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said President Joe Biden’s supplemental funding request to Congress, which includes military aid to Ukraine and Israel, would also benefit the US industrial base.

title: Apple Co-Founder Steve Wozniak Gets Serbian Passport Just Before Balkan Elections
description: Apple Inc. co-founder Steve Wozniak will receive a Serbian passport after accepting an offer from President Aleksandar Vucic just days ahead of parliamentary elections in the Balkan nation.

title: Guyana Boosts Security, Engages US to Defend Land from Venezuela
description: Guyana said it’s intensifying security measures and engaging the US military to help it protect the oil-rich region of Essequibo, describing Venezuela’s intentions to grant oil exploration licenses in the area as a threat to its territorial integrity.

title: Azerbaijan Warns Weapons Supplies to Armenia May Trigger New War
description: Azerbaijan’s President Ilham Aliyev on Wednesday warned France and India against providing Armenia with weapons he deems a threat, saying such supplies could trigger a new war in the region.

title: Boris Says Sorry: Former PM Apologises at Covid Inquiry
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Wall Street CEOs Testify Before Senate Panel
description: Jamie Diamond, Jane Fraser, James Gorman, and David Solomon. Photographer: Bloomberg

title: Putin Meets UAE Ruler on Rare Trip to Shore Up Gulf, Oil Ties
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin met United Arab Emirates President Sheikh Mohammed Bin Zayed Al Nahyan in Abu Dhabi at the start of a rare foreign trip to strengthen partnerships in the Middle East — defying US and European efforts to isolate him on the global stage.

title: Slovakia to Scrap Special Prosecutor in Rule-of-Law Dispute
description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico introduced legislation to abolish the Special Prosecutor’s Office, a move that’s triggered accusations of an attack on rule-of-law standards in the eastern European Union member state.

title: Italy Tells China It Will Exit Belt and Road Investment Pact
description: The government of Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni formally told China it would exit the Belt and Road Initiative, dealing a fresh blow to Beijing’s ambition to expand the massive investment program.

title: German Budget Turmoil Handcuffs Lindner on EU Fiscal Rules Deal
description: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner’s budget crisis at home is hampering his ability to strike a compromise over European Union fiscal rules in Brussels, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: US Sanctions Show Early Signs of Disrupting Russian Oil Tankers
description: US sanctions on a handful of tankers engaged in the Russian oil trade appear to have placed several of the ships in limbo, highlighting the scope such measures have to disrupt Moscow’s sales of petroleum.

title: EU Proposes Three-Year Delay Before EV Tariffs Hit UK Trade
description: The European Union proposed delaying by three years tariffs on electric vehicles traded with the UK that are set to kick in on Jan. 1, in a win for carmakers that warned the rules would unnecessarily hurt their operations.

title: India’s Battered Opposition Struggles to Regroup After Modi Win
description: Cracks are beginning to emerge among India’s opposition alliance after Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party routed its main rival in recent state elections, putting him in a strong position to stay in power for another five years.

title: The EU and China Are Both in Need of Some TLC
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Boris Johnson Apologizes for Pain and Loss During Pandemic
description: Former Prime Minister Boris Johnson apologized for the suffering and loss endured by Britons during the coronavirus pandemic as he took the stand to give his long-awaited evidence to the UK’s Covid-19 inquiry.

title: Wall Street Donors Keep Wallets Closed as 2024 Race Heats Up
description: Big Republican donors warned months ago that the only way to stifle Donald Trump’s comeback bid was to coalesce around one of his rivals.

title: Scholz Coalition Still Seeking Agreement on Revised 2024 Budget
description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz and his partners in Germany’s ruling coalition failed to reach a deal overnight on a revised 2024 budget and are set to continue negotiations at the chancellery in Berlin on Wednesday, according to people familiar with the talks.

title: Russia Hits Ukraine With Drone Barrage Amid US War Aid Worries
description: Ukraine suffered the largest Russian drone attack in more than ten days on Wednesday as American money for military support may run out amid stalled aid talks in Washington.

title: Putin Heads to Gulf in Show of Unity as Oil Cooperation Deepens
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is traveling to the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia Wednesday in a rare foreign trip that aims to bolster oil cooperation and counter efforts by the US and Europe to isolate him over the war in Ukraine.

title: South Africa Seeks Talks with Botswana over Food Ban Extension
description: The South African government has requested an urgent meeting with officials in Botswana after the neighboring country extended a ban on fresh produce imports that was set to expire this month.

title: Vietnam Is Said to Be Preparing for Xi Jinping’s Visit Next Week
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will likely visit Hanoi from Dec. 12-13, according to people with knowledge of the plan.

title: Dubai Extradites Hedge Fund Trader Shah to Danish Authorities
description: Sanjay Shah, a hedge-fund trader accused of masterminding a $1.9 billion tax fraud, has been extradited to Danish authorities just over a year after he was arrested in Dubai.

title: Japan’s Kishida Says Party to Treat Funding Scandal as Crisis
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said his party would go into crisis mode to overcome a financing scandal that’s undermined public trust, as his support slumps to lows for a leader not seen in more than a decade.

title: Fund Ukraine. The Alternative Is Loss, Not Peace.
description: Kyiv has to fight on because Putin believes he can still win.

title: Boris Johnson to Face Covid Inquiry Over Pandemic Handling
description: Former Prime Minister Boris Johnson will face two days of questioning over his handling of the coronavirus pandemic, the latest senior figure to give evidence to the UK’s Covid-19 inquiry.

title: Dublin Riots Exposed Anger of Irish Youth Facing Housing Crisis
description: On a chilly Thursday night in Dublin last month, the government and police were caught entirely off guard when violent riots broke out hours after a stabbing attack near a busy transit route in the city.

title: Eskom, Sasol Pollution Harms Children, Government Studies Find
description: Two studies ordered by South Africa’s government into the impact of air pollution on community and child health showed emission limits it imposed on companies that emit the toxins are insufficient.

title: Trump Pledges to Expand Drilling to Pay for Senior Benefits
description: Republican presidential frontrunner Donald Trump pledged to expand oil and gas drilling in remote areas of Alaska as a way to pay for Social Security benefits, a trade-off that is unlikely to pass muster with Congressional budget scorekeepers.

title: Biden’s Campaign Expects to Raise $15 Million in Five Days
description: President Joe Biden’s reelection campaign expects to raise more than $15 million in a series of events across the country and other appeals over the next five days, a person familiar with the efforts said Tuesday night.

title: Chinese Experts Push Back at Moody’s for Cutting Bond Outlook
description: Chinese experts hit back at Moody’s Investors Service for lowering its outlook on the nation’s sovereign bonds, questioning its understanding of the world’s second-largest economy.

title: Yellen Appeals to Congress as Republicans Block Fresh Aid to Ukraine
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said US lawmakers hold Ukraine’s fate in their hands as they block $61 billion in fresh funding requested by the Biden administration for the embattled East European country.

title: Biden ‘Heartbroken’ Over Fatal Military Osprey Crash in Japan
description: President Joe Biden said he was “heartbroken” over the loss of eight US service members likely killed in the crash of an Osprey military aircraft last week off a Japanese island.

title: Senegal Is Ranked Alongside Junta-Led Nations by Rights Group
description: Civil liberties have deteriorated to such an extent in Senegal that it now ranks alongside countries run by military juntas, according to an advocacy group that monitors rights globally.
